summary: The Veterans Emergency Care Reimbursement Act of 2025 amends Title 38 of the United States Code to modify limitations on reimbursing veterans for emergency treatment costs. Specifically, it clarifies how reimbursements apply when a veteran has a health-plan contract, including copayments, deductibles, and coinsurance. The bill defines relevant terms and clarifies the application of the amendment to past claims, including those in the Wolfe v. McDonough case.
